title: Cam Newton
summary: Cameron Jerrell Newton[1] (born May 11, 1989)[2] is an American football quarterback for the Carolina Panthers of the National Football League (NFL). Nicknamed "Super Cam",[3] he is the NFL career leader in quarterback rushing touchdowns at 73. Newton had college football stints at Florida and Blinn before joining Auburn, where he won the Heisman Trophy and 2011 BCS National Championship Game as a junior. He was selected first overall by Panthers in the 2011 NFL Draft.
